Administration.text:
Type: Contraceptive
Dosage Forms: Tablet 0.75mg, 1.5mg
Routes of Administration: oral, intrauterine (IUD)
Common Trade Names: Plan-B, most brands of combination OCPs, Mirena

Adult_Dosing.text:
Emergency contraception
: 0.75mg PO q12 x 2
OR
1.5mg PO once, as soon as possible within 72 hours of unprotected sex

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: X
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal Dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Pregnancy
IUDs only:
Active pelvic infection or STD
Immunocompromise
Known or suspected breast, uterine, or cervical cancer
Acute liver disease or liver tumor
Structural uterine anomaly including fibroids that distort uterine cavity

Serious.text:
Pills:
DVT
/PE, stroke, MI
Depression, suicidality
IUDs:
Ectopic pregnancy
Uterine perforation
PID, sepsis

Common.text:
Nausea, abdominal pain
Headache, dizziness
Abnormal vaginal bleeding, breast tenderness, ovarian cysts
Pills:
Acne
Fatigue
IUDs:
Pelvic pain, vulvovaginitis
Irregular menses, hypomenorrhea/amenorrhea

Serious.text:
Pills:
DVT

IUDs:

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Oral: 17-27.5h
Metabolism: Hepatic, primarily via CYP3A4
Excretion: Renal, fecal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Progestogen; inhibits ovulation or fertilization by altering tubal transport of sperm and/or ova
